moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4
comment:
So much for theory, as
far as my limited resources go. Though our wise database checkers may be able
to point out precedents..

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6
comment:
I'm not sure whether this is
the right time for Black to play this, limiting the c8 Bishop.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6
comment: A less quiet possibility here would be 9 ... c5 or 9 ... dxc4 followed by c5

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5
comment:
I had decided Black would not want 10 ... Qxd5 11 Bxc7 but after 11 .
.. Qc6 he does OK. My main intention was to have a position with d5 blocked,
thus making a queen side fianchetto unattractive.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5
comment:
Black goes for
the pawn capture anyway. After all, the c8 h3 diagonal is available again.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6
comment:
The Bishop is driven back but it may still be a
sacrificial force to be reckoned with  if  there is a build up against h3.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5
comment: A probing move, eyeing c6.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6
comment: A response that looks weakening

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5
comment:
An aggressive use of pawns in front of the King to keep me from
achieving results on the h6 square. It is surprising how well Black does with
this.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2
comment:
This was prompted by the attractive opening of the
d1 h5 diagonal in an attempt to combine Bishop and Queen against h7.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7
comment: Bringing more defensive forces into the arena.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2
comment:
The Qh5 line just
does not seem to break through. Black has enough defenders to ward off the
threats.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5
comment:
Another pawn in front of the king! No battening down of
hatches here. I decided to respond with a pawn thrust of my own, to give my g3
Bishop somewhere to retreat and to break things up a bit.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7
comment:
Now Black is building threats himself.  A well timed sac on h3 with
advanced pawns to follow.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2
comment: A bit of attack and defence. The Queen covers g4 and h5.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5
comment:
A sudden sw
itch to the queen side which does not seem to be in keeping with all the
activity on the other wing.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3
comment:
The Knight looks a little odd on the edge but it has avoided being pinned and
the following pawn push provokes a piece exchange which may well be the
turning point.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3 27. e5 Bxh4 28. Bxh4 Bg4
comment: Harassing the Queen may not be the best here. Perhaps Bf5 instead.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3 27. e5 Bxh4 28. Bxh4 Bg4 29. Qd2 Rf7
comment:
Again Black's choice looks doubtful. The Rook may have some defensive role
and perhaps even have an attacking square on g7 but ..

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3 27. e5 Bxh4 28. Bxh4 Bg4 29. Qd2 Rf7 30. Bf6 Kf8
comment: Trying to run before the Queen drops in.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3 27. e5 Bxh4 28. Bxh4 Bg4 29. Qd2 Rf7 30. Bf6 Kf8 31. Qh6+ Ke8 32. Bxe7

1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3 27. e5 Bxh4 28. Bxh4 Bg4 29. Qd2 Rf7 30. Bf6 Kf8 31. Qh6+ Ke8 32. Bxe7 Qxe7
comment:
And not with the Rook, as then 33. Qh8+  Kf7 
34. Rf1+. And not with the King as 33. Bg6 Rf8 34. Qg7 or Qh4+

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3 27. e5 Bxh4 28. Bxh4 Bg4 29. Qd2 Rf7 30. Bf6 Kf8 31. Qh6+ Ke8 32. Bxe7 Qxe7 33. Bg6 hxg2 34. Kxg2 Bf3+
comment:
Bf5 may have made White work harder, forcing White to win the
exchange before his Rook can take up an active role.

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Bg6 hxg2 34. Kxg2 Bf3+ 35. Kh2 Be2
comment: Again, Black might prolong matters with Be4

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Qc2 h5 18. f4 h4 19. Be1 Qd7 20. fxg5 fxg5 21. Rxf8+ Rxf8 22. Qe2 c5 23. Nf3 c4 24. Bc2 Bf6 25. e4 g4 26. Nxh4 gxh3 27. e5 Bxh4 28. Bxh4 Bg4 29. Qd2 Rf7 30. Bf6 Kf8 31. Qh6+ Ke8 32. Bxe7 Qxe7 33. Bg6 hxg2 34. Kxg2 Bf3+ 35. Kh2 Be2 36. Rg1 Bd3
comment: Too late, and my opponent later admitted he had thought I'd played Kg1 here!

moves: 1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bg5 Ne4 6. Bf4 Nxc3 7. bxc3 e6 8. e3 O-O 9. Bd3 b6 10. cxd5 exd5 11. O-O Bg4 12. h3 Be6 13. Ne5 f6 14. Ng4 g5 15. Bg3 Nc6 16. Nh2 Ne7 17. Bg6 hxg2 34. Kxg2 Bf3+ 35. Kh2 Be2 36. Rg1 Bd3 37. Bxf7+ Qxf7
comment: Finally the Rook, pinned since move 33, is removed.

comment: In view of 38...Qf8 39. Rg8 or 38. Ke7 Rg7
